{{also|Fragen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|vrāgen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|frāgēn}}, {{m|goh|frahen|frahēn/frāhēn}}, which is indirectly derived from {{der|de|gem-pro|*frēgōną}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*preḱ-||to ask}}.{{R:EWddS|ed=22|hw=Frage, fragen}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|De-fragen.ogg|audio}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈfʁaːɡən/|[ˈfʁaːɡŋ̩]}} * {{rhymes|de|aːɡn̩}} * {{hyphenation|de|fra|gen}} ===Verb=== {{head|de|verb|third-person singular present|fragt|or|frägt|past tense|fragte|or|frug|past participle|gefragt}} # to [[ask]] ({{m|de|nach}} for/after) # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[wonder]] #: {{ux|de|Ich '''frage''' mich, wer mir helfen kann.|I wonder who can help me.}} ====Usage notes==== * Generally, ''fragen'' has always been a weak verb. * The strong forms of ''fragen'' are secondary and now obsolete in formal writing. They live on in dialects and colloquial varieties. ====Conjugation==== ; Weak conjugation {{de-conj-weak|frag|gefragt|h}} ; Strong conjugation (rare) {{de-conj-strong|frag|frug|gefragt|h||fräg|früg|t|||a}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de|abfragen|anfragen|ausfragen|befragen|erfragen|Frage|Frager|fragwürdig|hinterfragen|nachfragen|überfragt|Umfrage|umfragen}} ===References=== ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:German class 6 strong verbs]] [[Category:German mixed verbs]]
